Description: AI-powered learning app for GCSE & A-Level students. Create lessons, generate flashcards, notes, and exam-style questions. Includes task planner, analytics, and premium features.

Auth: Sign Up (Name, Email, Password, Confirm; remind users to save password), Log In, Forgot Password link.

Home Page: List of lessons. Click to open a lesson container: AI-generated Notes, Flashcards, Exam Questions, Quiz. Filter by Subject, Level, Difficulty.

Lesson Creation: Button “Create Lesson” → select Subject, Level (GCSE/A-Level), Difficulty. AI generates lesson, flashcards, notes, exam-style questions, optional quiz. All content stored in the lesson container.

Flashcards: AI-generated, flippable, spaced repetition, tracks performance.
Notes: AI-generated, editable, searchable, key terms highlighted, optional export (premium).
Exam Questions/Quiz: AI generates questions per lesson & difficulty, graded with detailed feedback, hints for incorrect answers.

Analytics: Progress per subject, difficulty, task type. Graphs (line/pie charts). AI suggests weak topics. Export analytics (premium).

Premium Features (Apple Pay one-time payment): Unlimited lessons & flashcards, advanced AI explanations, exam simulator, export/print lessons, offline mode, priority AI content, dark/light mode customization, analytics export. Locked until payment verified.

Extra AI Features: Personalized AI study plan, adaptive difficulty, AI suggestions, Pomodoro timer, peer challenges/leaderboards, achievement badges, optional social sharing.

User Flow: Sign Up / Log In → Home → Create Lesson → Open Lesson → Choose activity → Complete tasks → Check Task Bar → Analytics → Premium unlock via Apple Pay.

1. In `LessonContext.tsx`, the `createLesson` function returns a `Promise<Lesson>` and properly returns the `newLesson` object
2. In `app/lesson/create.tsx`, the `handleSubjectTopicSelect` function awaits the `createLesson` call and stores the result in `newLesson`
3. **However**, the issue is that after the lesson is created, the code tries to navigate using `router.push(\`/lesson/${newLesson.id}\`)` but the `isGenerating` state is never set back to `false` if the navigation happens successfully

The problem is that the loading state (`isGenerating`) stays `true` and the UI remains stuck on the "Creating Lesson Container" screen. The navigation happens, but the user doesn't see it because the generating screen is still showing.
